alert.note: Alert for Central Yampa River Basin; Lower Yampa River Basin; Upper Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 21 at 2:02PM MST until December 23 at 12:00PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, snow and wind expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. * WHERE...Lower Yampa River Basin, Central Yampa River Basin and Upper Yampa River Basin. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 6 AM MST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from midnight tonight to noon MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility, especially in open areas. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. A detailed map of the snowfall can be found at: www.weather.gov/gjt/winter.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central Yampa River Basin; Lower Yampa River Basin; Upper Yampa River Basin
